text: thumb|Location of Nishimuro District in Wakayama Prefecture is a district located in Wakayama Prefecture, Japan. As of September 1, 2008, the district has an estimated Population of 42,840 and a Density of 98.9 persons/km2. The total area is 433.24 km2. ==Towns and villages== *Kamitonda *Shirahama *Susami ==Merger== *On April 1, 2005 the town of Kushimoto merged with the town of Koza, from Higashimuro District, to form the new town of Kushimoto, now part of Higashimuro District. *On May 1, 2005 the town of Nakahechi, and the village of Ōtō merged into the city of Tanabe. *On March 1, 2006 the town of Hikigawa merged into the town of Shirahama. Category:Districts in Wakayama Prefecture
title: Nishimuro District, Wakayama
